data.name: Battledroid
data.detailed_description:
In the distant future wages an endless struggle between autonomous megacorp armies with only one objective in mind: total domination of the Earth!

As an agent of one such megacorp, you must deploy your armies to battle for territory in order to squeeze resources from the Earth, and defend that territory from others, using your captured resources to build a greater army of higher technology and more lethal force.



The thrill of tabletop gaming in a massively multiplayer digital world!

Did you ever want to play games like Revenge of the Titans against other players as if you were playing a traditional war game? Now you can with BATTLEDROID!

MULTIPLAYER GLOBAL WARGAMING


BATTLEDROID is war gaming leveled up from the tabletop to the massively multiplayer! The entire world is at stake, every battle brings one faction or another closer to total victory.

BATTLEDROID is an evolution of the most exciting concepts from traditional tabletop war gaming at a global scale!

COLLECT THEM ALL


Armies found in BATTLEDROID are made up of many kinds of units. All are able to be collected by you over time as you conquer different territories - each territory harbours a different resource. Units have different stats, abilities, and battle costs.

Balance


You can use any unit at your disposal in your armies. Gameplay is balanced - every unit has a points cost. In defensive positions, increase your points allowance by capturing more territory. In attacks, you may only have an army that costs less than the defence.

Veterans


Bring glory to your armies with veteran units, available to purchase and keep.

Honour


Mount an attack against an overwhelmingly better defence, and win with honour! Gain XP from attacks against the odds, and spend your XP levelling up your veterans.

Reinforcements


In a hurry to bring firepower to your army? You can obtain units quicker by converting your hard-earned XP into GOLD and permanently swelling your ranks with units of your choice.


WAR!


From Europe, to Asia, to the Americas, Australasia, and Antarctica, the conflict rages on between the fierce capitalistic tech factions of BATTLEDROID.

Can you construct your defences to withstand the enemy attacks, build up your army of Battledroids, and advance your forces into enemy lines to claim victory for your faction?

Conquer!


The Earth is divided up into a huge hex-grid of territories, each harbouring a game resource. Successfully invade a territory and you can create armies that use those resources.

As you attack territories around the world and conquer them, your enemies will be doing the same. There are strategic advantages to maintaining contiguous (unbroken) territory, and to having lots of territory - but not advantages that prevent other players from defeating you!

Open up new and exciting strategies and possibilities as you progress. The larger your contiguous territory is, the more points you'll have when placing defences. The more territories your possess, the more different kinds of units you'll have to play with!

Defend!


Once you have conquered a territory, you capture the army within and it will act on your behalf. However, you can throw it away at any time and replace it with an army of your own. You must devise a well-structured and balanced army that can withstand attack in your absence!

Strategize!


Upon selecting a territory to attack, you are presented with a simulator, showing you the configuration of the incumbent defences. Plan your invasion! Select, deploy, and program your forces to tweak their autonomous strategy, to defeat the enemy.

Battledroids are fully autonomous and will fight as they see fit. Replay and adjust your strategy in the simulator. When you're happy with your plans, launch the attack, sit back, and wait to see the results!

Attack!


You can then watch the battle unfold as it happened from the safety of your remote command console. You are not guaranteed success in the real battle based on a successful simulation! Changes in the starting conditions can sometimes have a deciding effect. The trick is to design an attack such that the effect of these changes has minimal effect on the final outcome.

  • Processor: Dual Core 2GHz
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: OpenGL4.5 Compatible
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
